body:
Appears this is Spyder-specific when I try to repro. Can you confirm if you can reproduce in a standard console?

Standard console:
```
In [3]: l1 = test1
   ...: l2 = test1
   ...: l3 = test1
   ...: l4 = test1
   ...: l5 = test1
   ...: l6 = test1
   ...: df = pd.DataFrame({'C1':l1,'C2':l2,'C3':l3,'C4':l4,'C5':l5,'C6':l6})
   ...:
   ...:

In [4]: df
Out[4]:
                                         C1                    ...                                                           C6
0                           AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA                    ...                                              AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
1                          BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB                    ...                                             BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB
2                 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC                    ...                                    CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC
3  DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD                    ...                     DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD

[4 rows x 6 columns]
```

Spyder:
```
l1 = test1
l2 = test1
l3 = test1
l4 = test1
l5 = test1
l6 = test1
df = pd.DataFrame({'C1':l1,'C2':l2,'C3':l3,'C4':l4,'C5':l5,'C6':l6})



df
Out[4]: 
                                         C1                                        C2                                        C3                                        C4                                        C5                                        C6
0                           AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA                           AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA                           AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA                           AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA                           AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA                           AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
1                          BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB                          BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB                          BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB                          BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB                          BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB                          BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB
2                 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC                 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC                 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC                 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC                 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC                 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC
3  DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD  DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD  DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD  DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD  DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD  DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD
```

You are correct, it seems to be a Spyder-issue, I will post it over there then.

But now I stumbled over something else:

I opened the standard Command Prompt on Windows 10 and pasted the test code.

Now if I try to view the dataframe I don't see anything at all, it looks like this now:

	>>> print(df)
	  ...
	0 ...
	1 ...
	2 ...
	3 ...

	[4 rows x 6 columns]

Does the Windows Terminal have such a low amount of space that the algorithm just skips everything?

That happens both in the vanilla console and in iPython.

This looks to be fixed. Will be available in the upcoming release (0.24). Closing

```
In [39]: print(df)
                                         C1   C2       C3   C4                                        C5       C6
0                           AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA  123   5.2340  123                           AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA   5.2340
1                          BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB  456   9.5676  456                          BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB   9.5676
2                 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC  789   3.1415  789                 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC   3.1415
3  DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD  101  78.6600  101  DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD  78.6600
```
